title.narrative: Stöd till regionalisering av public service media i Ukraina
Support to Regionalisation of Public Service Media in Ukraine

description.narrative:
Development objective: Strengthened freedom of expression in Ukraine with public service media as a tool for democracy and empowerment. Project objective: Strengthened management, content and public outreach with a focus on regional integration of public service media in Ukraine.
The project cooperation between NPBU and SRMDO aims at strengthening the role of NPBU to realize its potential of being an effective and independent nationwide Public Service Media, PSM, upholding public service values in reporting and programming in Ukraine and thus contributing to building democracy and freedom of expression. Supporting digitalization and integration of the previously disintegrated regional branches into one national company as a whole would contribute to stregthening nation-wide outreach of NPBU as the public service company of Ukraine. The regional integration project implies embarking on a strategic path of “stitching” together the vast conflict-torn country media-wise and is a unique feature for the proposed cooperation.
The project set-up can be summarized into the following areas describing the content of the project and the changes that will be addressed at the National Public Broadcaster of Ukraine in order to reach the intended project objective, its outcomes and outputs:
1) The management structure in NPBU as the owner of the Public Service Media company’s change management, development, position and outreach must be on board and aware of what changes are happening in the intevention at the regional level and why. NPBU management is expected to communicate the reforms and lead by example, knowing and respecting their own role in making things happen. In the process of stitching together the new organization, the management’s role is vitally important.
2) Robust, transparent and relevant steering tools will be established and put in place by the Programme in order to create a unified entity of the disparate 28 branches of the National Public Broadcasting Company of Ukraine.
3) Establishment and development of criteria for measurement (public service media content as well as financial, human resources etc. respectively) will be developed and put in place to contribute to NPBU’s continued existence and interaction with its commissioning body.
4) Development of and complementing the existing technical system for news exchange, today named “Suspilne”, will be done with the purpose of making it more relevant to the needs of the newsrooms and in turn contribute to integration of regions and HQ.
5) Creating a platform and work-flow for digital output (i.e. publication means) throughout the whole organization in order to enable quicker, more reliable and trustworthy news on all platforms. Keeping up with development in the media market/sector and to reach out and interact with its audience is essential for a public service company’s existence.
6) Journalistic versatility and “universality”: journalistic competence will be strengthened aiming at a higher level of technical and journalistic knowledge. This implies another way of working, not least in the regions where the journalists need to adapt to full-cycle work tasks in order for NPBU to be relevant to its audience. Together with the new work-flow for digital output this would enable quicker, more reliable, trustworthy news on a variety of platforms in the regions as well as the capital.

Sveriges Radio MDO har ansökt om 34 742 899 SEK för implementeringen av programmet ”Support to Regionalisation of Public Service Media” (Stöd till regionalisering av public service) i Ukraina under perioden 2017-2021.
Projektsamarbetet mellan Ukrainas nationella radio och Tv-station (NPBU) och Sveriges Radio MDO syftar till att stärka NPBU:s möjligheter att bli ett effektivt och oberoende public service-medium med nationell räckvidd som upprätthåller public service-värderingar i rapportering och programmering och som på så sätt bidrar till att bygga demokrati och yttrandefrihet. Stöd till digitalisering och integrering av NPBU:s regionala grenar till en nationell organisation kommer att bidra till att stärka mediets nationella räckvidd. Projektet innebär en strategisk ansats att sy ihop det konfliktdrabbade landet ur ett medieperspektiv och är det föreslagna samarbetets unika särdrag.

Sveriges Radio MDO has applied to the Embassy for funding of 34 742 899 SEK to carry out the "Support to Regionalisation of Public Service Media" Programme in Ukraine during the period 2017-2021.
The project cooperation between National Public Broadcaster of Ukraine and Sveriges Radio MDO aims at strengthening the role of NPBU to realize its potential of being an effective and independent nationwide Public Service Media, PSM, upholding public service values in reporting and programming in Ukraine and thus contributing to building democracy and freedom of expression. Supporting digitalization and integration of the previously disintegrated regional branches into one national company as a whole would contribute to stregthening nation-wide outreach of the public service media company of Ukraine. The regional integration project implies embarking on a strategic path of “stitching” together the vast conflict-torn country media-wise and is a unique feature for the proposed cooperation.

The development goal of the project is strengthening media freedom of expression in Ukraine via enhancing outreach of public service media as a democratic tool. The main focus in this cooperation project is on the digital transformation and modernizing the regional network of the newly established Ukrainian public service broadcaster.
The key objective of the project is:
"Public service media in Ukraine would strengthen digital news publishing, develop work flows and increase public outreach in UA:PBC regional branches by 2022.
The project has five outcomes:
Outcome 1: UA: PBC's regional branches will have a clear understanding of public service values.
Outcome 2: Increased trust by audience in UA:PBC's regional branches by 2022.
Outcome 3: Efficient work flow implemented in UA:PBC's regional branches.
Outcome 4: User-friendly platforms for digital news publishing developed and being used by staff and audience in UA:PBC's regional branches.
Outcome 5: Strengthened management and journalistic capacity in UA:PBC's regional branches.
The objectives remained unchanged as a result of Contribution Amendment 1 signed in November 2021.
During Phase II the project aims to further strengthen the editorial development in the regional branches of UA:PBC by promoting the digital first and the multimedia journalism mindsets, news planning in the regional newsrooms and improving the content in the regional news. The new multimedia work flow and digital transformation are expected to contribute to the growth of the audience outreach and the public trust in public service media's content.

description.narrative:
Phase I key achievements as to SRMDO's digital transformation of the Ukrainian public service broadcaster:
1. Comprehensive national and regional news strategies of UA:PBC were developed and combined in a single framework for better public outreach on all digital platforms. The unified digital news strategy became the driver of delivery for values-based journalism online.
2. As a result of the successful application of the digital news strategy, news website suspilne.media launched with the project from scratch in December 2019 generated 69 million page views in 2020. In January-August 2021 the digital outreach of suspilne.media ecosystem has reached around 17M users and 71M page views, which is almost half of the adult population of the country.
3. Public service criteria including trust of the audience were put at the heart of the editorial and digital transformation. As of 2021, Suspilne's web-page is proud to be on the "white list" and among the top three leaders on compliance with the professional standards in online media according to the rating run by independent NGO "Institute of Mass Information", Ukrainian partner of RSF.
This project is being implemented via agile methodology. In its Phase I SRMDO has piloted the design and implementation of the digital work flow for the whole ecosystem of the Ukrainian public broadcaster in the four regional pilot stations: UA:Rivne, UA:Karpaty, UA:Lviv and UA:Kharkiv. SRMDO has built regional branches' capacities through a peer-to-peer exchange, learning and coaching approach. The Project applied twinning arrangements where SRMDO and the local partner worked together at all levels of the company to accomplish strategic, long-term institutional capacity development. Measurements of audience' trust underpinned the project trajectory.
